Comments_List: I developed a greater understanding of the connection between Roman law and Latin American literature from the modern period. I also developed greater close reading skills and insights into the authors of the period.
I think the strength of the course is in the selection of the texts as well as Professor Echevarra, who was a most engaging instructor.  There's little I would suggest in terms of improvement.
I would recommend the course to any student interested in modern Latin American literature, and its canonical works, and for understanding the connection to Roman law.
